justcil.title: justcil
justcil.description: Just parse and output the CIL.

justcfg.title: justcfg
justcfg.description: Only output the CFG in cfg.dot .

verify.title: verify
verify.description: Verify that the solver reached a post-fixpoint. Beware that disabling this also disables output of warnings since post-processing of the results is done in the verification phase!

mainfun.title: mainfun
mainfun.description: Sets the name of the main functions.

exitfun.title: exitfun
exitfun.description: Sets the name of the cleanup functions.

otherfun.title: otherfun
otherfun.description: Sets the name of other functions.

allglobs.title: allglobs
allglobs.description: Prints access information about all globals, not just races.

result.title: result
result.description: Result style: none, fast_xml, json, pretty, json-messages, sarif.

allfuns.title: allfuns
allfuns.description: Analyzes all the functions (not just beginning from main). This requires exp.earlyglobs!

colors.title: colors
colors.description: Colored output (via ANSI escape codes). 'auto': enabled if stdout is a terminal (instead of a pipe); 'always', 'never'.

g2html.title: g2html
g2html.description: Run g2html.jar on the generated xml.

save_run.title: save_run
save_run.description: Save the result of the solver, the current configuration and meta-data about the run to this directory (if set). The data can then be loaded (without solving again) to do post-processing like generating output in a different format or comparing results.

load_run.title: load_run
load_run.description: Load a saved run. See save_run.

compare_runs.title: compare_runs
compare_runs.description: Load these saved runs and compare the results. Note that currently only two runs can be compared!

warn_at.title: warn_at
warn_at.description: When to output warnings. Values: 'post' (default): after solving; 'never': no warnings; 'early': for debugging - outputs warnings already while solving (may lead to spurious warnings/asserts that would disappear after narrowing).

gobview.title: gobview
gobview.description: Include additional information for GobView (e.g., the Goblint warning messages) in the directory specified by 'save_run'.

jobs.title: jobs
jobs.description: Maximum number of parallel jobs. If 0, then number of cores is used. Currently used for preprocessing and g2html.

keep.title: pre.keep
keep.description: Keep the intermediate output of running the C preprocessor.

kernel_includes.title: pre.kernel_includes
kernel_includes.description: List of kernel directories to include.

custom_includes.title: pre.custom_includes
custom_includes.description: List of custom directories to include.

original-path.title: pre.compdb.original-path
original-path.description: Original absolute path of Compilation Database. Used to reroot all absolute paths in there if moved, e.g. in container mounts.

split.title: pre.compdb.split
split.description: Split Compilation Database entries containing multiple .c files.

transform-paths.title: pre.transform-paths
transform-paths.description: Normalize and relativize paths in parsed CIL locations. Can cause issues locating YAML witness invariants due to differing paths.

inlines.title: cil.merge.inlines
inlines.description: Merge inline functions (by their body printout).

cstd.title: cil.cstd
cstd.description: Specify the c standard used for parsing.

gnu89inline.title: cil.gnu89inline
gnu89inline.description: Indicates whether gnu89 semantic should be used for inline functions.

unix-socket.title: server.unix-socket
unix-socket.description: The path to the UNIX socket

reparse.title: server.reparse
reparse.description: Reparse source files before each analysis run

enums.title: ana.int.enums
enums.description: Use IntDomain.Enums: Inclusion/Exclusion sets. Go to top on arithmetic operations (except for some easy cases, e.g. multiplication with 0). Joins on widen, i.e. precise integers as long as not derived from arithmetic expressions.

congruence.title: ana.int.congruence
congruence.description: Use IntDomain.Congruence: (c, m) option, meaning congruent to c modulo m

refinement.title: ana.int.refinement
refinement.description: Use mutual refinement of integer domains. Either 'never', 'once' or 'fixpoint'. Counterintuitively, may reduce precision unless ana.int.interval_narrow_by_meet is also enabled.

def_exc_widen_by_join.title: ana.int.def_exc_widen_by_join
def_exc_widen_by_join.description: Perform def_exc widening by joins. Gives threshold-widening like behavior, with thresholds given by the ranges of different integer types.

interval_narrow_by_meet.title: ana.int.interval_narrow_by_meet
interval_narrow_by_meet.description: Perform interval narrowing by meets. Avoids precision loss if intervals are refined by def_exc ranges, which are more precise than type range.

interval_threshold_widening.title: ana.int.interval_threshold_widening
interval_threshold_widening.description: Use constants appearing in program as threshold for widening

interval_threshold_widening_constants.title: ana.int.interval_threshold_widening_constants
interval_threshold_widening_constants.description: Which constants in the program should be considered as threshold constants (all/comparisons)

debug.title: ana.pml.debug
debug.description: Insert extra assertions into Promela code for debugging.

hashcons.title: ana.opt.hashcons
hashcons.description: Should we try to save memory and speed up equality by hashconsing?

equal.title: ana.opt.equal
equal.description: First try physical equality (==) before {D,G,C}.equal (only done if hashcons is disabled since it basically does the same via its tags).

disjoint_types.title: ana.mutex.disjoint_types
disjoint_types.description: Do not propagate basic type writes to all struct fields

enabled.title: ana.autotune.enabled
enabled.description: Try to intelligently select analyses based on analysed file

wp.title: ana.wp
wp.description: Weakest precondition feasibility analysis for SV-COMP violations

interval.title: ana.base.context.interval
interval.description: Integer values of the Interval domain in function contexts.

interval_set.title: ana.base.context.interval_set
interval_set.description: Integer values of the IntervalSet domain in function contexts.

limit-string-addresses.title: ana.base.limit-string-addresses
limit-string-addresses.description: Limit abstract address sets to keep at most one distinct string pointer.

keep-expr.title: ana.base.partition-arrays.keep-expr
keep-expr.description: When using the partitioning which expression should be used for partitioning ('first', 'last')

partition-by-const-on-return.title: ana.base.partition-arrays.partition-by-const-on-return
partition-by-const-on-return.description: When using the partitioning should arrays be considered partitioned according to a constant if a var in the expression used for partitioning goes out of scope?

smart-join.title: ana.base.partition-arrays.smart-join
smart-join.description: When using the partitioning should the join of two arrays partitioned according to different expressions be partitioned as well if possible? If keep-expr is 'last' this behavior is enabled regardless of the flag value. Caution: Not always advantageous.

domain.title: ana.base.arrays.domain
domain.description: The domain that should be used for arrays. When employing the partition array domain, make sure to enable the expRelation analysis as well. When employing the unrolling array domain, make sure to set the ana.base.arrays.unrolling-factor >0.

unrolling-factor.title: ana.base.arrays.unrolling-factor
unrolling-factor.description: Indicates how many values will the unrolled part of the unrolled array domain contain.

domain.title: ana.base.structs.domain
domain.description: The domain that should be used for structs. simple/sets/keyed/combined-all/combined-sk

forward.title: ana.base.structs.key.forward
forward.description: Whether the struct key should be picked going from first field to last.

avoid-ints.title: ana.base.structs.key.avoid-ints
avoid-ints.description: Whether integers should be avoided for key.

prefer-ptrs.title: ana.base.structs.key.prefer-ptrs
prefer-ptrs.description: Whether pointers should be preferred for key.

not-started.title: ana.base.priv.not-started
not-started.description: Exclude writes from threads that may not be started yet

must-joined.title: ana.base.priv.must-joined
must-joined.description: Exclude writes from threads that must have been joined

blobs.title: ana.base.invariant.blobs
blobs.description: Whether to dump assertions about all blobs. Enabling this option may lead to unsound asserts.

unassume.title: ana.base.invariant.unassume
unassume.description: How many times to unassume an invariant: once or until fixpoint (at least twice as expensive).

deep-query.title: ana.base.eval.deep-query
deep-query.description: Perform EvalInt queries on all subexpressions, not just the outermost expression.

wrappers.title: ana.malloc.wrappers
wrappers.description: Loads a list of known malloc wrapper functions.

unique_address_count.title: ana.malloc.unique_address_count
unique_address_count.description: Number of unique memory addresses allocated for each malloc node.

strengthening.title: ana.apron.strengthening
strengthening.description: Apply strengthening in join for extra precision with heterogeneous environments. Expensive!

domain.title: ana.apron.domain
domain.description: Which domain should be used for the Apron analysis. Can be 'octagon', 'interval' or 'polyhedra'

threshold_widening.title: ana.apron.threshold_widening
threshold_widening.description: Use constants appearing in program as threshold for widening

threshold_widening_constants.title: ana.apron.threshold_widening_constants
threshold_widening_constants.description: Which constants in the programm should be considered as threshold constants

diff-box.title: ana.apron.invariant.diff-box
diff-box.description: Only generate truly relational invariants by subtracting non-relational box invariants

not-started.title: ana.relation.priv.not-started
not-started.description: Exclude writes from threads that may not be started yet

must-joined.title: ana.relation.priv.must-joined
must-joined.description: Exclude writes from threads that must have been joined

one-var.title: ana.relation.invariant.one-var
one-var.description: Generate invariants with only one variable

widen.title: ana.context.widen
widen.description: Do widening on contexts. Keeps a map of function to call state; enter will then return the widened local state for recursive calls.

domain.title: ana.thread.domain
domain.description: Which domain should be used for the thread ids. Can be 'history' or 'plain'

include-node.title: ana.thread.include-node
include-node.description: Whether the node at which a thread is created is part of its threadid

free.title: ana.race.free
free.description: Consider memory free as racing write.

lines.title: ana.dead-code.lines
lines.description: Print information about lines of dead code.

assume_success.title: ana.extract-pthread.assume_success
assume_success.description: Assume that all POSIX pthread functions succeed.

ignore_assign.title: ana.extract-pthread.ignore_assign
ignore_assign.description: Ignores any assigns in POSIX programs.

precheck.title: ana.unassume.precheck
precheck.description: Check if invariant contradicts reached state before unassuming.

load.title: incremental.load
load.description: Load incremental analysis results, in case any exist.

load-dir.title: incremental.load-dir
load-dir.description: Location where to load incremental analysis results from.

only-rename.title: incremental.only-rename
only-rename.description: Only reset IDs of unchanged objects in the AST. Do  not reuse solver results. This option is mainly useful for benchmarking purposes.

save-dir.title: incremental.save-dir
save-dir.description: Location where to save incremental analysis results to.

stable.title: incremental.stable
stable.description: Reuse the stable set and selectively destabilize it (recommended).

wpoint.title: incremental.wpoint
wpoint.description: Reuse the wpoint set (not recommended). Reusing the wpoint will combine existing results at previous widening points.

enabled.title: incremental.reluctant.enabled
enabled.description: Destabilize nodes in changed functions reluctantly

compare.title: incremental.compare
compare.description: Which comparison should be used for functions? 'ast'/'cfg' (cfg comparison also differentiates which nodes of a function have changed)

funs.title: incremental.force-reanalyze.funs
funs.description: List of functions that are to be re-analayzed from scratch

enabled.title: incremental.restart.sided.enabled
enabled.description: Restart affected side-effected variables (transitively) to bot.

vars.title: incremental.restart.sided.vars
vars.description: Side-effected variables to restart. Globals are non-function entry nodes. Write-only is a subset of globals.

fuel.title: incremental.restart.sided.fuel
fuel.description: Initial fuel for bounding transitive restarting, which uses one fuel each time when following side_fuel to restart. Zero fuel never restarts. Negative fuel doesn't bound (infinite fuel).

fuel-only-global.title: incremental.restart.sided.fuel-only-global
fuel-only-global.description: Decrease fuel only when going to constraint system globals (not function entry nodes).

list.title: incremental.restart.list
list.description: List of globals variables and function definitions for which the analysis is to be restarted.

write-only.title: incremental.restart.write-only
write-only.description: Restart write-only variables to bot during postprocessing.

superstable-reached.title: incremental.postsolver.superstable-reached
superstable-reached.description: Consider superstable set reached, may be faster but can lead to spurious warnings

spawn.title: sem.unknown_function.spawn
spawn.description: Unknown function call spawns reachable functions

globals.title: sem.unknown_function.invalidate.globals
globals.description: Unknown function call invalidates all globals

args.title: sem.unknown_function.invalidate.args
args.description: Unknown function call invalidates arguments passed to it

args.title: sem.unknown_function.read.args
args.description: Unknown function call reads arguments passed to it

dead_code.title: sem.builtin_unreachable.dead_code
dead_code.description: __builtin_unreachable is assumed to be dead code

dead_code.title: sem.noreturn.dead_code
dead_code.description: For the purposes of detecting dead code, assume that functions marked noreturn don't return.

signed_overflow.title: sem.int.signed_overflow
signed_overflow.description: How to handle overflows of signed types. Values: 'assume_top' (default): Assume signed overflow results in a top value; 'assume_none': Assume program is free of signed overflows;  'assume_wraparound': Assume signed types wrap-around and two's complement representation of signed integers

dereference.title: sem.null-pointer.dereference
dereference.description: NULL pointer dereference handling. assume_top: assume it results in a top value, assume_none: assume it doesn't happen

fail.title: sem.malloc.fail
fail.description: Consider the case where malloc or calloc fails.

fail.title: sem.lock.fail
fail.description: Takes the possible failing of locking operations into account.

activated.title: trans.activated
activated.description: Lists of activated transformations. Transformations happen after analyses.

query_file_name.title: trans.expeval.query_file_name
query_file_name.description: Path to the JSON file containing an expression evaluation query.

output.title: trans.output
output.description: Output filename for transformations that output a transformed file.

enabled.title: annotation.int.enabled
enabled.description: Enable manual annotation of functions with desired precision, i.e., the activated IntDomains.

privglobs.title: annotation.int.privglobs
privglobs.description: Enables handling of privatized globals, by setting the precision to the heighest value, when annotation.int.enabled is true.

enabled.title: annotation.float.enabled
enabled.description: Enable manual annotation of functions with desired precision, i.e., the activated FloatDomains.

goblint_array_domain.title: annotation.goblint_array_domain
goblint_array_domain.description: Enable manual annotation of arrays with desired domain

goblint_relation_track.title: annotation.goblint_relation_track
goblint_relation_track.description: Let relation track variables only if they have the attribute goblint_relation_track

priv-prec-dump.title: exp.priv-prec-dump
priv-prec-dump.description: File to dump privatization precision data to.

priv-distr-init.title: exp.priv-distr-init
priv-distr-init.description: Distribute global initializations to all global invariants for more consistent widening dynamics.

prec-dump.title: exp.relation.prec-dump
prec-dump.description: File to dump relation precision data to.

mincfg.title: exp.mincfg
mincfg.description: Try to minimize the number of CFG nodes.

earlyglobs.title: exp.earlyglobs
earlyglobs.description: Side-effecting of globals right after initialization.

unique.title: exp.unique
unique.description: For types that have only one value.

forward.title: exp.forward
forward.description: Use implicit forward propagation instead of the demand driven approach.

volatiles_are_top.title: exp.volatiles_are_top
volatiles_are_top.description: volatile and extern keywords set variables permanently to top

single-threaded.title: exp.single-threaded
single-threaded.description: Ensures analyses that no threads are created.

exclude_from_earlyglobs.title: exp.exclude_from_earlyglobs
exclude_from_earlyglobs.description: Global variables that should be handled flow-sensitively when using earlyglobs.

exclude_from_invalidation.title: exp.exclude_from_invalidation
exclude_from_invalidation.description: Global variables that should not be invalidated. This assures the analysis that such globals are only modified through known code

g2html_path.title: exp.g2html_path
g2html_path.description: Location of the g2html.jar file. If empty, then goblint executable directory is used.

extraspecials.title: exp.extraspecials
extraspecials.description: List of functions that must be analyzed as unknown extern functions

basic-blocks.title: exp.basic-blocks
basic-blocks.description: Only keep values for basic blocks instead of for every node. Should take longer but need less space.

fast_global_inits.title: exp.fast_global_inits
fast_global_inits.description: Only generate one 'a[any_index] = x' for all assignments a[...] = x for a global array a[n].

architecture.title: exp.architecture
architecture.description: Architecture for analysis, currently for witness

gcc_path.title: exp.gcc_path
gcc_path.description: Location of gcc. Used to combine source files with cilly. Change to gcc-9 or another version on OS X (with gcc being clang by default cilly will fail otherwise).

cpp-path.title: exp.cpp-path
cpp-path.description: Path to C preprocessor (cpp) to use. If empty, then automatically searched.

unrolling-factor.title: exp.unrolling-factor
unrolling-factor.description: Sets the unrolling factor for the loopUnrollingVisitor.

hide-std-globals.title: exp.hide-std-globals
hide-std-globals.description: Hide standard extern globals (e.g. `stdout`) from cluttering local states.

tef.title: dbg.timing.tef
tef.description: Filename for Trace Event Format (TEF) output. Disabled if empty.

context.title: dbg.trace.context
context.description: Also print the context of solver variables.

dump.title: dbg.dump
dump.description: Dumps the results to the given path

timeout.title: dbg.timeout
timeout.description: Stop solver after this time. 0 means no timeout. Supports optional units h, m, s. E.g. 1m6s = 01m06s = 66; 6h = 6*60*60.

solver-stats-interval.title: dbg.solver-stats-interval
solver-stats-interval.description: Interval in seconds to print statistics while solving. Set to 0 to deactivate.

solver-signal.title: dbg.solver-signal
solver-signal.description: Signal to print statistics while solving. Possible values: sigint (Ctrl+C), sigtstp (Ctrl+Z), sigquit (Ctrl+\), sigusr1, sigusr2, sigalrm, sigprof etc. (see signal_of_string in gobSys.ml).

backtrace-signal.title: dbg.backtrace-signal
backtrace-signal.description: Signal to print a raw backtrace on stderr. Possible values: sigint (Ctrl+C), sigtstp (Ctrl+Z), sigquit (Ctrl+\), sigusr1, sigusr2, sigalrm, sigprof etc. (see signal_of_string in gobSys.ml).

solver-progress.title: dbg.solver-progress
solver-progress.description: Used for debugging. Prints out a symbol on solving a rhs.

print_wpoints.title: dbg.print_wpoints
print_wpoints.description: Print the widening points after solving (does not include the removed wpoints during solving by the slr solvers). Currently only implemented in: slr*, td3.

n.title: dbg.slice.n
n.description: How deep function stack do we analyze.

widen.title: dbg.limit.widen
widen.description: Limit for number of widenings per node (0 = no limit).

warn_with_context.title: dbg.warn_with_context
warn_with_context.description: Keep warnings for different contexts apart (currently only done for asserts).

regression.title: dbg.regression
regression.description: Only output warnings for assertions that have an unexpected result (no comment, comment FAIL, comment UNKNOWN)

cilcfgdot.title: dbg.cilcfgdot
cilcfgdot.description: Output dot files for CIL CFGs.

loop-clusters.title: dbg.cfg.loop-clusters
loop-clusters.description: Add loop SCC clusters to CFG .dot output.

node.title: dbg.compare_runs.node
node.description: Compare nodes (with joined contexts) in compare_runs

print_tids.title: dbg.print_tids
print_tids.description: Should the analysis print information on the encountered TIDs

print_protection.title: dbg.print_protection
print_protection.description: Should the analysis print information on which globals are protected by which mutex?

run_cil_check.title: dbg.run_cil_check
run_cil_check.description: Should the analysis call Check.checkFile after creating the CFG (helpful to verify that transformations respect CIL's invariants.

race-threshold.title: warn.race-threshold
race-threshold.description: Races with confidence at least threshold are warnings, lower are infos.

term.title: solvers.td3.term
term.description: Should the td3 solver use the phased/terminating strategy?

side_widen.title: solvers.td3.side_widen
side_widen.description: When to widen in side. never: never widen, always: always widen, sides: widen if there are multiple side-effects from the same var resulting in a new value, cycle: widen if a called or a start var get destabilized, unstable_called: widen if any called var gets destabilized, unstable_self: widen if side-effected var gets destabilized, sides-pp: widen if there are multiple side-effects from the same program point resulting in a new value, sides-local: Widen with contributions from variables from which multiple side-effects leading to a new value originate.

space.title: solvers.td3.space
space.description: Should the td3 solver only keep values at widening points?

space_cache.title: solvers.td3.space_cache
space_cache.description: Should the td3-space solver cache values?

space_restore.title: solvers.td3.space_restore
space_restore.description: Should the td3-space solver restore values for non-widening-points? Not needed for generating warnings, but needed for inspecting output!

narrow-reuse.title: solvers.td3.narrow-reuse
narrow-reuse.description: Reuse value when switching from widening to narrowing phase. Avoids one unnecessary re-evaluation.

remove-wpoint.title: solvers.td3.remove-wpoint
remove-wpoint.description: Remove widening points after narrowing phase. Enables a form of local restarting which increases precision of nested loops.

skip-unchanged-rhs.title: solvers.td3.skip-unchanged-rhs
skip-unchanged-rhs.description: Skip evaluation of RHS if all dependencies are unchanged - INCOMPATIBLE WITH RESTARTING

enabled.title: solvers.td3.restart.wpoint.enabled
enabled.description: Restart wpoint to bot when (re-)detected. Allows incremental to avoid reusing and republishing imprecise local values due to globals (which get restarted).

once.title: solvers.td3.restart.wpoint.once
once.description: Restart wpoint only on first detection. Useful for incremental loading.

restart_count.title: solvers.slr4.restart_count
restart_count.description: How many times SLR4 is allowed to switch from restarting iteration to increasing iteration.

id.title: witness.id
id.description: Which witness node IDs to use? node/enumerate

other.title: witness.invariant.other
other.description: Emit invariants at all other locations

split-conjunction.title: witness.invariant.split-conjunction
split-conjunction.description: Split conjunctive invariant to multiple invariants

accessed.title: witness.invariant.accessed
accessed.description: Only emit invariants for locally accessed variables

full.title: witness.invariant.full
full.description: Whether to dump assertions about all local variables or limitting it to modified ones where possible.

exact.title: witness.invariant.exact
exact.description: Emit exact invariants. They are useless for unassuming.

inexact-type-bounds.title: witness.invariant.inexact-type-bounds
inexact-type-bounds.description: Emit inexact invariants matching type bounds.

exclude-vars.title: witness.invariant.exclude-vars
exclude-vars.description: OCaml Str regexes for variables to exclude from invariants.

goblint.title: witness.invariant.goblint
goblint.description: Emit non-standard Goblint-specific invariants. Currently array invariants with all_index offsets.

uncil.title: witness.uncil
uncil.description: Try to undo CIL control flow transformations in witness

entry-types.title: witness.yaml.entry-types
entry-types.description: YAML witness entry types to output/input.
